page.title: 03ATTITUDES
page.content:
AREA SOUTH OF WESTWOODSIDE
AN AIR OF CONTENTMENT PERVADES AMONGST THE SCATTERED COMMUNITY. THE PEACEFUL ENVIRONMENT, ALMOST TO THE POINT OF ISOLATION, IS THE ATTRACTION. THE MAJORITY OF DWELLERS ARE FARMERS, WHO WITH SUCCEEDING GENERATIONS, HAVE CONTINUED TO LIVE AND WORK CONTENTEDLY, DESPITE THE REMOTENESS. ON THE OTHER HAND THERE ARE A FEW INCOMERS, WHO LHAVE SPECIFICALLY CHOSEN THIS AREA, AS AN ESCAPE FROM THE HUSTLE AND BUSTLE OF THE URBAN AREAS. RESERVARTIONS WERE EXPRESSED BU SEVERAL OF THE NON FARMING COMMUNITY REGARDING THE DISAPPEARING HEDGEROWS, REMOVED BY THE FARMERS FOR EASE OF ACCESS TO THE FIELDS. AS A RESULT THE TOPE SOIL IS GRADUALLY BEING ERODED AWAY. SPRAYING MAY CAUSE CONTAMINATION OF NATURAL HERBAGE.
